snippet: Robert Kagan has called for the president to resist a popular pull toward making the United States a nation without larger responsibilities.
abstract: Advance of militants from Iraq and Syria on Baghdad has resurrected debate over American interventionism and Pres Obama's vision of smaller American scope; historian Robert Kagan's arguments that America's great power and responsibility requires its continued intercession in world affairs have been reinvigorated by conflict.
lead_paragraph: Robert Kagan has called for the president to resist a popular pull toward making the United States a nation without larger responsibilities.

headline.seo: Robert Kagan Strikes a Nerve With Article on Obama Policy
headline.main: Events in Iraq Open Door for Interventionist Revival, Historian Says
headline.print_headline: Historian’s Critique of Obama Foreign Policy Is Brought Alive by Events in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
